hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Liquidity Recovery Hierarchy
hypothesis_content.statement: After broad market stress events, altcoins recover liquidity in predictable sequence: Large caps (ETH, SOL) first (days 1-3), then mid-caps (days 3-5), then small caps (days 5-8). Trading the spread between recovery cohorts yields 12-18% annualized alpha.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers allocate limited risk capital hierarchically after drawdowns. They first restore liquidity to highest-volume, most profitable pairs (large caps), then trickle down to riskier assets. This creates a predictable recovery gradient that can be arbitraged.
entry_conditions: Large-cap liquidity score has recovered to 90% of pre-stress levels
No asset-specific negative news in target cohort
Overall market volume trending upward for 2+ days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Target cohort liquidity reaches 85% of large-cap recovery level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Large-cap liquidity deteriorates by >10% from entry level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If recovery happens simultaneously across caps OR if small caps recover faster than large caps.
